page.title: How To Clear Temp Files from the Server

revision.text:
If the site is going really slow and reports aren't running in full, you might be out of disk space. Try the following: * Remote into Server: 184.106.39.62 U: Administrator
P: $44#Moodle$ * Navigate to C:\Windows\Temp and delete all the files and empty the Recycle Bin. This may cause site slow downs and server errors, in which case: * Open start menu and click on or search for Internet Information Sevices (IIS) Manager * On left, expand [+] MOODLE then select Application Pools * Right click esomoodle_app and select Recycle * Good job! You fixed it! [[Category:HowTo]] [[Category:Moodle_Changelog]] [[Category:Restricted]]

== Activity Icons ==
The method for changing the icon image associated with an activity is the same for every activity, only the folder accessed is different.
# Using FTP, you'll want to find the folder "/mod" and, within, the folder of the activity you want to edit, for instance "/choice". (note that the "Assignment" activity is actually governed by the "/assign" folder. The "/assignment" folder is included in Moodle for backwards compatibility) # Within the activity folder, find the folder "/pix". # You should see three image files titled "icon", a .gif file, a .png file, and a .svg file. Replace all the images.
For a list of all the images that were changed, see the files in [[:Category:Moodle_Activity_Icons]]
== File Icons ==

# Using FTP, you'll want to find the folder "/pix/f". # You should see several images named after the file type. For instance, you'll see a file "html.gif" and nine "html-##.png" files for various sizes. You'll need to replace all of these images.

In /mod/zoom/view.php around line 130 you'll see: 
$link = html_writer::tag('form', $buttonhtml, array('action' => $aurl->out_omit_querystring()));

$link = html_writer::tag('a', $buttonhtml, array('href' => $aurl, 'target' => "_blank"));

page.title: Fix DST Error on Course Restore

revision.text:
[[Category:Moved_to_GitHub]] [[Category:Moodle_2.7]] [[Category:Changes_Overridden_By_Update]]
There are various issues associated with Daylight Saving Time. One that affects us is that, when you restore or reset a course that straddles the DST change, Moodle will overcompensate for DST. for instance, if you took a course starting 1/14/2015 with assignments due at 10:59 PM, and reset it to begin 2/25/2015, the assignments in week 1 would remain due at the proper time, but those in week 2 (after DST) would get pushed forward an extra hour to 11:59 PM.
This issue may be resolved in Moodle 2.9, but for the time being, it can be fixed by using a new file in /lib/timezone.txt
A current file should be available in this Moodle tracker: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-44569

$choices = uu_supported_auths();

page.title: Allow User to See Quickfind List

revision.text:
[[Category:Moved_to_GitHub]] [[Category:Settings_Change]]
To allow a non-manager to see the Quickfind List (aka the All Users List), they must have several permissions on a SITE-WIDE level. Rather than assigning a user their current role on a site-wide basis, which could have many negative consequences, best practice is to create a new role with the necessary permissions. We'll call our role "Quickfind List User" (shortname: quickfind) and make it available only on a system context. The three permissions you need to allow for this role are:
* "Use Quickfind List" (block/quickfindlist:use) under "Block: Quickfind List" category * "View hidden details of users" (moodle/user:viewhiddendetails) under "Course" category ** Technically not necessary, but otherwise you won't be able to see which classes a user is enrolled in, making the Quickfind List fairly useless * "Manage blocks on a page" (moodle/site:manageblocks) under "Block" category ** Makes "Turn Editing On" appear on the page, which for some reason is necessary for the block to be seen by non-admins
After making this change, you'll probably also want to make the following change as well: [[Automatically_Redirect_to_User%27s_Sitewide_Profile]]

[[Category:Moved_to_GitHub]] [[Category:Settings_Change]]
It is possible to hide the Administration block from regular students on most pages. This allows us to keep the courses looking clean without making it difficult for admins or teachers to make changes to courses. To do this:
# Turn editing on # Click the key icon under the Administration block title # In the menu on the left, under "Block: Administration" click "Permissions" # Next to the capability "View Block", remove any roles that you do not want to see the Administration block by clicking the grey "x" to the right of the role's name. Generally, you will want to remove "Guest", "Student", and "Authenticated User" # Add any roles that will need the Administration block with the "+" icon. For instance, the custom roles [[Chef Mentor]] and [[Supervisor]]
Students will still be able to see the Administration block on their profile page, where they need it to change their user pictures.

page.title: Change Logo Based on Custom Field

revision.text:
[[Category:Outdated_Moodle_Changes]] [[Category:Essential_Theme]] [[Category:Snap_Theme]] This must be done for every theme used on the site. Here we will change the logo based on the "Campus" custom field ('fieldid' => '6'), but this can be done based on other or additional variables. == Essential Theme (Desktop Theme) == Open /theme/essential/layout/includes/header.php Near the tob of the file, immediately after the 'require_once' lines (around line 29), add the following: 
global $DB, $USER;
$campus = $DB->get_record('user_info_data', array('userid'=>$USER->id,'fieldid'=>'6'))->data;
The '$campus' variable will be used to change the logo. Later down, around line 64, you'll see the following code: 
wwwroot); ?>" title="">
Replace it with this: 
wwwroot); ?>" title="" style="
">
What we are doing here is adding a blank style property to the anchor tag that displays the site logo. Within the quotes, we add some PHP to check if the '$campus' variable we set up matches one of several predetermined values, and if so, echo some CSS to change the logo image. YOU MUST MAKE SURE THAT THE IMAGE AT THIS PATH EXISTS. == Snap Theme (Mobile Theme) == Open /theme/snap/layout/nav.php Near the top of the file, after the opening comments, call the necessary globals and initialize your '$campus' variable as in the 'essential' theme: 
global $DB, $USER;
$campus = $DB->get_record('user_info_data', array('userid'=>$USER->id,'fieldid'=>'6'))->data;
Since this theme echoes a long list of variables to create the anchor tag, rather than using lots of in-line PHP, we want to create a new variable we can use next: 
$campus_style = '';
Then set the variable (if applicable) using a slightly modified version of our 'if' statement: 
if (($campus == 'Austin')||($campus == 'Boulder')||($campus == 'Boulder - Online')) {
	$campus_style = "background-image: url('//dev.escoffieronline.com/theme/essential/pix/aesca.png') !important;"; 
}
Finally, edit the following line in the code (around line 35): 
echo ''.$sitefullname.'';
To include our new '$campus_style' variable in the 'style' attribute: 
echo ''.$sitefullname.'';
== Other Themes == Since all themes are coded differently, you'll have to modify these steps slightly for any other themes used. The hardest part is simply finding where the anchor tag housing the logo is created. It *SHOULD* always be somewhere in the directory /theme/THEME-NAME/layout/ and will often be in a file called 'header.php', but not always. Loook through all of the layout files searching for a tag with the attribute 'class' set to "logo".

[[Category:Employee_Resources]]
== Vacation Benefits ==
Effective Date: 01/01/2013
Triumph Higher Education, August Escoffier School of Culinary Arts, and Escoffier Online International Culinary Academy (the “Company”) offers vacation time off with pay to eligible employees for rest, relaxation, and personal pursuits. Employees in the following employment classifications are eligible to earn and use vacation:
* Regular full-time employees regularly scheduled to work 40 hours per week throughout the full year * Regular part-time employees regularly scheduled to work at least 1040 hours per year (20 hour/week)
'''Employees grandfathered into a prior PTO/FTO plan will not be eligible to participate in this plan.
'''Temporary employees whether full or part-time will not be eligible to participate in this plan.'''
The amount of paid vacation time you receive each calendar year (January thru December) increases with the length of your employment as shown in the following schedule:
* In the 1st calendar year of employment: ** Full-time employees who start active employment between January 1 and June 30th, will accrue 1.67 hours of vacation time per semi-monthly pay period to use during that calendar year. Part-time employees will accrue a pro-rata amount of vacation based upon their normal hours scheduled. ** Full-time and part-time employees, who start active employment between July 1 and December 31 will accrue zero (0) hours of vacation to use during that calendar year. * In the 2nd calendar year of employment, the employee will accrue 80 hours (10 days) of vacation to use during that calendar year (earned at the rate of 3.34 hours per semi-monthly pay period). Part-time employees will accrue a pro-rata amount of vacation based upon their normal hours scheduled.
Example: Regular part-time employees will accrue vacation pay on a pro-rata basis calculated on their normal hours worked. For example, a part-time employee who regularly works 20 hours per week, accrues 1.67 hours per semi-monthly pay period in their 2nd calendar year of employment.
* In the calendar year following the employee’s 5th anniversary of employment, the employee will accrue 120 hours (15 days) of vacation to use during that calendar year (earned at the rate of 5 hours per semi-monthly pay period). Part-time employees will accrue a pro-rata amount of vacation based upon their normal hours scheduled.
Each employee is responsible for submitting requests for vacation at least 2 weeks in advance of the first day of desired vacation. All vacation requests must be submitted and approved by the employee’s manager prior to starting the vacation time.
Vacation time off is paid at the employee’s base pay rate at the time of the vacation. It does not include overtime or any special forms of compensation such as bonuses.
We encourage employees to use available paid vacation time for rest, relaxation, and personal pursuits.
=== Black-Out Dates ===
The Company reserves the right to “black out” dates for which employees in certain positions and/or departments are not eligible to take vacation time for proper and adequate coverage in the department.
=== Use it or Lose it ===
The vacation policy is commonly known as a “use it or lose it” policy. That means that In the event that the employee does not use his/her available vacation by the end of the benefit year, s/he will lose the unused time.
=== Termination of Employment ===
Employees may not use vacation time in lieu of notice of resignation. In addition, vacation time cannot be used to extend the termination date. The last day actually worked will be considered the date of termination from the Company.
If employment terminates, the employee will be paid for any unused vacation time that has been accrued and not yet taken, through the last day of work. In addition, if the employee has taken time not yet accrued, the pay for this time will be deducted from his/her final pay. If the final paycheck is not sufficient to cover the deduction, the employee will reimburse the company for any vacation time used by not yet accrued.
Any questions on this policy should be directed to your supervisor or to the human resources representative.
== Sick-Leave Benefits ==
Effective Date: 01/01/2013
Triumph Higher Education, August Escoffier School of Culinary Arts, and Escoffier Online International Culinary Academy, (the “Company”) provides paid sick pay benefits to eligible employees for periods of temporary absence due to illnesses or injuries. Employees in the following employment classifications are eligible for sick leave:
* Regular full-time Employees regularly scheduled to work 40 hours per week throughout the year. * Regular part-time Employees scheduled to work at least 1,040 hours per year (20 hours/week).
'''Employees grandfathered into a prior PTO/FTO plan will not be eligible to participate in this plan.'''
'''Temporary employees whether full or part-time will not be eligible to participate in this plan.'''
Full-time employees will receive sick pay for a maximum of 56 hours (7 days) in a calendar year. These hours will be credited to the employee’s account on January 1st of each year.
Regular part-time employees will receive sick pay on a pro-rata basis calculated on their normal hours worked. For example, a part-time employee who regularly works 20 hours per week will receive 28 hours of sick pay per year. These hours will be credited to the employee’s account on January 1st of each year.
In the first calendar year of employment, employees whose employment begins between January 1st and July 31st will receive 40 hours of sick pay for that year and employees hired between August 1st and December 31st will not receive any sick pay until the next calendar year.
'''Employees must complete 90 days of employment before sick pay may be used.'''
Sick pay can be used in minimum increments of one hour. You may use sick pay for an absence due to your own illness or injury, your own doctor/dentist appointment, or to care for a sick child. Documentation from a physician of the child’s illness may be required.
If an employee is sick, and needs to use more than his/her sick pay allowance, s/he '''must''' use his/her unused sick pay balance and then any unused vacation time for balance of the absence. If there is no sick pay or unused vacation time, that absence will be unpaid.
=== Reporting requirements ===
If an employee is unable to report to work due to illness or injury, he/she is required to telephone his/her manager a minimum of 2 hours before the scheduled start time. If the manager does not answer the phone, the employee may leave a detailed voicemail message along with a phone number where s.he can be reached if necessary. Asking another employee, a friend or a relative to provide notification is not acceptable except in emergency situations where the employee is disabled and unable to make the call.
The manager must also be contacted by telephone on each additional day of absence until the employee has returned to work.
=== Job Abandonment ===
An employee who is absent from work for three (3) or more consecutive work days without officially notifying his/her manager will be considered to have abandoned his/her job. Job abandonment is considered a voluntary resignation by the employee.
=== Doctor’s Note Requirement ===
If the employee is absent for three (3) or more consecutive work days due to illness or injury, a physician's statement must be provided verifying the illness and its beginning and expected ending dates. The same verification may be requested for other sick leave absences as well and may be required as a condition of receiving sick leave benefits. '''Before returning to work from a sick leave absence of three (3) calendar days or more, the employee must provide a physician's verification that s/he may safely return to work.'''
Sick pay will be calculated based on the employee’s base pay rate at the time of the absence and will not include any special forms of compensation, such as overtime, or bonuses.
If the employee is on an extended absence, s/he must apply for any other available compensation and benefits, such as workers' compensation. Sick pay will be used to supplement any payments that the employee is eligible to receive from state disability insurance, workers' compensation, or other disability programs. The combination of any such disability payments and sick leave benefits may not exceed the employee’s normal weekly earnings.
'''Sick pay that is not used will not be considered accrued and will not be paid out upon separation of employment. In no case shall unused sick pay be carried over from one year to the next, nor will it be paid out if not used during the year.'''
== Bereavement Leave ==
Effective Date: 01/01/2013
In the event that an employee needs to take time off to attend the funeral in the event of the death of an immediate family member, the Company (Triumph Higher Education, August Escoffier School of Culinary Arts, and Escoffier Online International Culinary Academy) provides bereavement leave. To request bereavement leave, the employee should see his/her supervisor.
Eligible employees are granted up to two (2) consecutive days of paid bereavement leave to attend the funeral or wake of an immediate family member (as defined below) if the employee is scheduled to work on those days. Eligible employees include the following classifications:
* Regular full-time employees regularly scheduled to work 40 hours per week throughout the year. * Regular part-time employees scheduled to work at least 1,040 hours per year (20 hours/week)
'''Temporary employees whether they are full or part-time are not eligible for benefits under this policy.'''
During paid bereavement leave, the employee’s pay will be calculated based on his/her base pay rate at the time of absence, excluding any special forms of compensation, such as bonuses or overtime.
=== Immediate Family Definition (up to 2 days of paid time) ===
* Current spouse or domestic partner * Child or step-child * Employee’s parent or step- parent * Mother-in-law or father-in-law * Employee’s brother, sister or step brother/sister * Grandchild(ren) * Employee’s Grandparent
To be eligible for paid bereavement leave, the employee must attend the funeral of the deceased relative.
=== Other Relatives (up to 1 day of paid time) ===
One (1) day of paid bereavement leave may be may be granted to attend the funeral or wake of the employee’s:
* Sister/brother-in-law * Spouse’s grandparent * Aunt/uncle/cousin * Spouse’s aunt/uncle or cousin
To be eligible for paid bereavement leave, the employee must attend the funeral of the deceased relative.
We will normally grant bereavement leave unless there are unusual business needs or staffing requirements that prevent accommodating the request.
The employee may also, with supervisory approval, use unused vacation time (PTO/FTO) for additional time off as necessary.
Employees must notify their manager upon becoming aware of the death of a family member. Upon the employee’s return to work, proof of the family member’s death must be given (i.e., obituary, church program, etc.) as proof of attendance at the wake or funeral.
Questions on this policy should be directed to human resources.
== Jury Duty ==
Effective Date: 04/18/2013
The Company (Triumph Higher Education, Auguste Escoffier School of Culinary Arts and Escoffier Online International Culinary Academy) encourages you to fulfill your civic responsibilities by serving jury duty when required.
If you are eligible for paid jury duty leave, you will be compensated at your base rate of pay for the number of hours you would normally have worked that day, up to a maximum of three (3) paid days. If you receive pay from the court for the jury duty, you will provide proof of payment and repay the Company for pay for time served (payment for mileage, if any, by the courts is not subject to payment to the Company). Employees in the following classifications are eligible for paid jury duty leave:
* Regular full-time employees regularly scheduled to work 40 hours per week throughout the year.
If you remain on jury duty beyond the period of paid jury duty leave, you may use any available paid time off, such as vacation time, or request an unpaid jury duty leave of absence.
=== The employees’ responsibility when s/he receives a jury duty summons: ===
* Provide a copy of the jury duty summons to both your supervisor and the business manager (campus employees) or the controller (corporate and online employees) no later than 2 weeks prior to the date you are required to report for jury duty. * Provide both your supervisor and the business manager/controller an estimate of when you expect to return to work. * Provide to both your supervisor and the business manager/controller proof of attendance or receipt of payment for jury duty from the court. This must be done immediately upon your return to work. * Provide to the business manager/ controller payment to the company for the amount received from the court for jury service (mileage allowance, if any, provided by the court is not required to be paid to the Company). This payment must be made within 2 days of your return to work.
You are expected to report for work whenever the court schedule permits. Thus, if you are in court for only a partial day, you are required to return to work to work the rest of your shift.
Either you or the Company may request you be excused from jury duty if necessary. We may request that you be relieved from serving on jury duty if we believe that your absence would cause serious operational difficulties for the Company.
Subject to the terms, conditions, and limitations of the applicable plans, the Company will continue to provide health insurance benefits until the end of the calendar month in which you are taking unpaid jury duty leave. At that time, you will become responsible for the full cost of those benefits in order for coverage to continue. When you return from unpaid jury duty, the Company will resume providing those benefits according to the applicable employee benefit plans.
Benefit accruals, such as vacation, sick leave, or holiday benefits, will be suspended during unpaid jury duty leave and will resume when you return to active employment.
== Witness Duty ==
Effective Date: 04/18/2013
The Company (Triumph Higher Education, Auguste Escoffier School of Culinary Arts, and Escoffier Online International Culinary Academy) provides witness duty time off to employees who receive a subpoena to testify in court. If you are summoned or otherwise requested to testify as a witness by the Company, you will receive paid time off for the entire period of witness duty.
You will be granted unpaid time off if you are requested to appear in court as a witness by a party other than the Company. However, you must use any available paid leave benefits, such as vacation/FTO/PTO, to be compensated for that absence.
In order to make arrangements for the time off, you must show the subpoena to your manager as soon as you receive it and provide a copy to the campus business manager – corporate/online employees are to provide a copy to the controller. When serving as a witness, you are expected to report to work whenever you are not needed in court.
== Holiday Schedule ==
Following is the list of company holidays in 2015. The corporate office and ground campuses will be closed on these days:

'''NOTE:''' Employees in certain departments (i.e., Admissions, Financial Aid, etc.) may be required to work on holidays due to the nature of our business. Please check with your manager.
